content.description:
“Together with an immense expansion of democracy which for the first time becomes democracy for the poor, democracy for the people, and not democracy for the rich folk, the dictatorship of the proletariat produces a series of restrictions of liberty in the case of the oppressors, the exploiters, the capitalists. We must crush them in order to free humanity from wage-slavery; their resistance must be broken by force; it is clear that where there is suppression there is also violence, there is no liberty, no democracy.”

Lenin, State and Revolution, written in 1917, published in 1918
content.question:
In your response, be sure to address all parts of the question. Use complete sentences; an outline or bulleted list alone is not acceptable.

a) Describe Lenin’s purpose in writing the text.

b) Explain how Lenin’s rhetoric provides information about Russia’s situation in 1917.

c) Describe the ideology that was the primary influence on Lenin’s writing.
